21.0: 1- "We don't trap fish" even though slaughtering, baking and cooking are major categories of labor [which are prohibited on the Sabbath], and those labors are permitted for the needs of the holiday, the reason there [for permitting those labors] is that it would be impossible [to do these labors] before the holiday, because with slaughtering we are concerned that the meat will spoil. However, with trapping you can trap the fish while its still the day [before the Holiday], and put it aside in water and it wont die, and on the next day [i.e. the holiday] you can take it from the water.

6.0: On account of buying and selling - that buying and selling is similar to take out from his domain and transfer the object to the holy domain [the Temple].  This action is forbidden by Torah which states "[honor the Sabbath by not] seeking out your personal desires, nor discussing [forbidden] matters." (Isaiah 58:13).  Or alternatively, buying and selling will cause someone to write a bill of sale.    And if you would say...
